snippet: Telcel, a unit of América Móvil, settled a dispute with Mexico’s antitrust commission, which agreed to drop a $925 million fine.
abstract: Telcel, a unit of wireless carrier America Movil, settles a dispute with Mexico's antitrust commission, which agrees to drop a $925 million fine; company will change its pricing practices. Photo (M)c
lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY -- Mexico's antitrust commission said on Thursday that it was dropping a fine of nearly $1 billion against the local unit of the wireless carrier América Móvil in return for a promise by the company to change its pricing practices. The deal requires the company, Telcel, which controls about 70 percent of Mexico's wireless market, to stop giving its customers discounted rates for calls to other Telcel users, a policy that competitors say has made it hard to compete.

headline.main: Mexico Drops Big Fine in Settlement With Wireless Carrier
